reviews.review:
I have mixed feelings about this expansion, it surely feels like a let down after playing the first expansion for Half life: Oppossing Force, which adds a lot more content, like new eapons and enemies, CTF Multiplayer mode, and lot of other new features, Blue Shift in comparison is pretty standard, it doesn't add any new weapons or enemies, and is realy short, it takes about 3 hours to beat it, however it also adds a few puzzles here and there, which are easy to figure it out, except maybe one of them near the end game, and updated HD graphics, but personally, I think is not enough, it gets even worse when you realize that there are some free mods out there that are longer, have more custom content and are more original than it

Overall? If you played Half Life and Opposing Force and you still are looking for more, give it a try, is not bad, but is not groundbreaking either, I got it with the Valve Complete Pack Bundle and I'm happy for having played it, but I would be pretty mad if I had to pay full price for it though
9 из 10

My updated video review:
https://youtu.be/zStOftibR0M

[b]Intro[/b]
A very short (Steam says 2 hours in the past 2 weeks, and I finished it in about 3 days, and probably let it open while AFK at some point, on Hard) extension to Half-Life that unfortunately and curiously does nothing new and adds nothing new besides some 'HD' models for this, the original game and Opposing Forces,
but is still enjoyable enough to be worth it.

[b]The Great:[/b]
++N/A

[b]The Good:[/b]
+A more effective intro than the original game's
+Significantly harder than the first three quarters of the original game, which I'm very pleased about
+Decent sound design

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-The puzzles are all mind-numbingly simple, besides, like, two where I got stuck because they weren't obvious at all even though they took about 2 seconds (literally) to do for each

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-Characters and story are totally uninteresting
-Lasts about two hours
-Adds absolutely nothing besides HD models. No new weapons, enemies, unique scenarios, nothing. It's the bare minimum for an expansion pack, really. Well, a 90's FPS expansion pack anyway.
-Utterly forgettable
-Tiny FOV by default. No easy permanent way to change it.
-AI seems even dumber

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--Half-Life looked out of date for 1998, so Blue Shift looks ancient for 2001, even with the HD models (which I don't even like)

Sound: 7/10
Graphics: 3/10
Gameplay: 6/10
Content/Replayability: 1.5/10
Overall: 6/10

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Inoffensive, but totally forgettable. Play once, somewhat enjoy, never think about again type afare.

[u] Gameplay [/u]
an expansion pack for Half-Life, Blue Shift is a first-person shooter. The overall gameplay of Blue Shift does not significantly differ from that of Half-Life: players are required to navigate through the game's levels, fight hostile characters and solve a variety of puzzles to advance

[u] Review [/u]
The weakest and the easiest DLC out the two but still very enjoyable to play, it's all about a security guard who tries to find his way out of Black Mesa Research Facility, finding some scientist along the way to help you esacpe. Wait for a sale to come on since it's not very long.

Not your average shift! 7.5/10
Experience The Black Mesa Incident through the eyes of a Security Guard

Half Life: Blue Shift is the second expansion for the first Half Life game. You play as Barney Calhoun, the guy who owes Freeman a beer :), the gameplay is similar to the previos expansion pack, it's a good game but it's too short, you can finish it in about 3 hours. And for the fact that this is included in the Half-Life and Valve bundles, it's worth it and I recommend it.

Half-Life: Blue Shift is a classic old expansion for the Half-Life universe.

PROS AND CONS:

+ Has the lovely Half Life vibe

+ Nice idea of being a guard in the Half-Life universe

+ Great gunfeel

+ It's half life lol

CONS:

- A lil short (2-4 hours)

- Has a few of the same environments as the main game

- Does not add that much new story to the Half life series.

Overall: 8/10 I really liked it but it is a bit more of just the same. For me that isn't a problem because I am a big fan of the franchise. But it definetly is a great expansion.

Blue Shift is unique for one simple reason: you're basically a nobody. Barney, along with the scientists he meets along the way, simply wants to get out of Black Mesa alive and preferably in one piece. This expansion provides a refreshing change of pace and a different perspective on the Resonance Cascade and the rest of the incident. Any fan of Half-Life worth his salt should check out Blue Shift.

Seconde extension pour Half-Life après Opposing Force, toujours réalisée par Gearbox, Blue Shift propose de vivre les événements de Black Mesa du point de vue d'un agent de sécurité.
L'expérience proposée est à la hauteur de celle proposée par le jeu d'origine et sa seconde extension, les seules réelles ombres au tableau étant l'absence de nouvelles armes et de nouveaux ennemis alors que c'était le cas dans Opposing Force. En outre la durée de vie est ici encore plus courte.
Malgré tout Blue Shift reste un incontournable de son époque.

I was surprised how much I actually liked Blue Shift.  To be honest I liked it better than it's parent game, but I think that may have been the more human element to it.  You do not get a shiny new HEV suit to make you super human, you are just a security guard with some body armor and a side arm or two.  Of course the game does not put you in such extreme situations that Gordon Freeman was put in, that needed such a suit either, for the most part.

Regardless, I think what I liked the most about the game was the extra areas that you could not see in the original.  Basically the inner workings of Black Mesa.  Also the length, at least for me, was pretty short, only a fraction of the original.  Some may complain about it's briefness, but it keeps the pace and flows nicely, with some brain teasers and extra side stories that made HL1 better to understand.  There were not many times I was wishing the darn thing would end, as it's parent game had, which seemed to drag on and on at times...  

Also when originally released in disc format, I believe it added better looking textures.  This of course does not do anything now in the digital age, as everything is updated automatically, but I am sure it was a big deal back then, since it updated the textures for the original HL1 and I believe at least also in Opposing Force as well.

I highly recommend this for any HL1 fan who may have missed it, either never installing the disc back in the day or bought the original on Steam without thinking of giving this a try.  Me being rather cheap, I do recommend buying it on a Summer Sale (as it is now at the time of this writing) or a Winter one, due to it's quick play time.  For 99 cents you can not go wrong regardless of the length.  In fact I am about to go into hard mode and see just how fast I can actually beat it!  ^_^
ㅤㅤㅤ

[h1]Half-Life: Blue Shift[/h1]
I would call it DLC for the original Half-Life game. It is a return to the Black Mesa Research Facility in which you play as Barney Calhoun, the security guard. You are experiencing a whole new story with a different character. And other parts of the complex. In the game are used other weapons than in original version. The whole game was very entertaining and occasional puzzles were a good change after the fight with enemies. Also definitely, every half-life fan will be happy with occasional seeing of Gordon Freeman. I surely recommend buying the game, for example in a deluxe package where all half-life games are located.
--------------

Chi non ha giocato Half Life (il primo) non si può neanche considerare un gamer, giocate Half Life, è OBBLIGATORIO per ogni gamer che si rispetti!

Но не смотря, что все аддоны не смогли превзойти халф лайф они достой встали в ряд отличных игр.
Blue Shift мне показалась намного сложнее оригинала, ну и запутаней так как в мире хен я психовал, и хотел раздолбить монитор, потому что хен был тута однобразным и более чем на половину его проползаешь раком на корточках, а после этого отбиваемся от кучи монсров и возвращаемся домой где его ждут блек джек и шлюхи ученые.
Это самая коротка Half Life, но самая хорошая ведь тута хорошая концовка! Но по понятным всем причинам говорить её не буду.
Оценка:7.2/10

controls are broken.

Good add on for a great game. I liked the story and the perspective. The ending was more rewarding than many HL games IMO. One criticism would, however, be that it is too short. Way too short. Only five levels, none of which are any bigger than Half-Life's. It also upgrades the core of Half-Life and Opposing Force, and perhaps more significantly upgrades all three games cosmetically, with characters and weapons looking a lot cooler.

Espansione che ci mette nei panni di una guardia di sicurezza di Black Mesa durante il periodo  del disastro dimensionale. Offre spunti di trama interessanti e diversi collegamenti con la storia principale di Freeman
brocken

Short but fun gameplay

[h1]λ Badass Barney λ[/h1]

Blue Shift to wydany w 2001 roku drugi oficjalny dodatek do gry Half Life.

[quote][h1]Fabuła (uwaga spoilery): [/h1]
Powracamy do ośrodka badawczego Black Mesa. Gdy meldujemy sie na posterunku (jeszcze przed eksperymentem Gordona) dowiadujemy sie że wszystko tego dnia ma usterki. Akcja zaczyna sie gdy zmierzając w głąb bazy dochodzi do katastrofy. Na naszych oczach z portali wychodzą obcy i mordują wszystkich dookoła. Podczas ratowania swojego życia dowiadujemy się że jest możliwość ucieczki. W ukrytej części ośrodka znajduję sie eksperymentalny portal. Niestety by z niego skorzystać musimy sie nieźle nasilić. Tak naprawdę wszystko co napotykamy na swojej drodze dobrze znamy z Half-Life'a, tylko oczami naszego drogiego Calhoun'a.

[h1]Grafika:[/h1]
Bardzo podobna jak w Half-Life, z delikatną poprawą. Jak na 2001 rok można by spodziewać się jakiegoś większego polepszenia ale i tak jest bardzo dobrze.

[h1]Muzyka: [/h1]
Bardzo dobrze wpasowana do sytuacji jaka panuje na ekranie. Świetne udźwiękowienie obiektów, pomieszczeń, wrogów oraz broni. 
[/quote]
 
[quote][h1]No ale jak w to pykać?[/h1]
Podobnie jak w poprzednim dodatku gra jest pierwszoosobową strzelanką, a tryb prowadzenia gry nie uległ zmianom. Na naszej drodze spotkamy znanych z „podstawki” wrogów takich jak obcy czy jednostki specjalne HECU. Nasz bohater posiada ograniczony arsenał broni znany z HL. Nie raz musimy wykazać się zdolnością zręcznego poruszania się czy też logicznym myśleniem (łamigłówki). Tak samo jak w częściach poprzednich będziemy napotykać laborantów których będziemy musieli eskortować. Gra jest zdecydowanie krótsza od swoich dwóch poprzedników (około 3 godziny gry).
Bardzo pozytywne odczucia gdy napotykaliśmy Gordona Freemana z sytuacji znanych z HL jak np. [spoiler]przyjazd do pracy, rozmowa widziana przez kamery, pojmanie[/spoiler]

[h1]… ugi BUGI …?[/h1] 
Brak.
 [/quote]

[quote][h1]Co wyszło grze na zdrowie:[/h1]
+ grafika
+ muzyka
+ grywalność
+ fabuła wydarzeń z Half-Life oczami strażnika ochrony

[h1]Co szkodzi całości:[/h1]
- postać ślizga się

[h1]Polecana dla tych, którzy lubią:[/h1]
☑ klasyczne FPS'y o świetnej fabule
[/quote]

[h1]꧁Ocena: 8.5/10꧂[/h1]
